item.title: Model-View-Presenter in Android
item.description: Intro A while ago I stumbled upon this article by Antonio Leiva about implementing the MVP architecture in Android. Iâ€™ve always wanted to organize my code better, and MVP sounded like a good idea. I theory, Android is all about MVC, with the Activity or Fragment being the controller and the view defined in XML layouts. In practice, you end up with a lot of view logic in the Activity. The MVP approach promises to solve this by assuming that the Activity or Fragment is the view, controlled by a Presenter.
